text: I'm always looking for new salads that
would pack beautifully for lunch and I
think I've finally met my match with
this broccoli salad with whole wheat
couscous and raisins super simple to
make another salad that just improves
with time in the refrigerator so I'm
gonna chop up my broccoli florets save
this stem in for steaming later this is
a little intense just for raw so we're
gonna use the nice tender fleuret ends
here and cut this into about bite-sized
pieces we're aiming for about a cup
broccoli is one of those great
nutritional powerhouse vegetables I'm
always looking for new ways to use it I
often just steam it or roast it so I
really like the idea of using the raw
florets here just gonna give it a chop
chop whoo I see my water spoiling here I
started with 2/3 cup of water I seasoned
it with salt and add 1/3 cup couscous
I'm using the whole wheat couscous here
that is available in most grocery stores
I like that hit of full grain goodness
give it a little bit of a stir and then
turn the heat off and cover it we'll let
this stand until it's tender which is
about 5 minutes
so back to the broccoli here okay so
we're gonna chop up one more little
floor out here so this is a great one to
use that farmers market fresh broccoli
when you see it in the market because
it's raw you want to definitely start
with the highest quality you can find so
spend 5 minutes check on the couscous
looks great all the water's absorbed so
transfer this to a large mixing bowl so
I always like to fluff couscous in the
pot this just helps all the ingredients
we incorporate a little bit easier in
the mixing bowl
okay to that let's add one cup of
chopped broccoli florets half a cup of
chickpeas I just used a can should be
here such a strain and rinse really well
and I'll see you his home cooked
chickpeas are gonna add a really nice
protein hit to this salad to that two
tablespoons of golden raisins another
reason to add the golden raisins while
the couscous is still a little bit warm
is that the heat helps plump them a
little bit making a little bit more
tender and soft let's get the dressing
together 1 tablespoon of red wine
vinegar so the red wine vinegar just has
a nice little sourness and the golden
raisins are gonna form kind of like
agrodolce a sweet sour combination
really tasty and then 2 teaspoons of
extra virgin olive oil just enough to
coach season with salt and pepper
so the feta we're using will add a nice
hit of saltiness there you want to
season on the lighter side and then
taste let's give this a spin oh this
looks wonderful and last but not least
we have a quarter cup of feta cheese
just crumbled add it to the top so this
will also add a nice hint of salt and
creaminess and a good amount of protein
as well
calcium what's not to love about feta so
this is ready for me to pack for lunch
as is if you want extra credit you can
also throw in a hard cooked egg you
could also pair this with simple canned
sardines be really delicious all right
let's give it a try smells wonderful
mmm oh that's really good guys this is
so tasty the raisins with the feta and
the broccoli and the chickpeas really
really tasty so good now but you know
what it's gonna be even better a couple
hours from now so this makes it a great
make-ahead lunch
